title: loss prevention for intentional feeders?
body: I would like to see league of legends implement some form of loss prevention for people that go into games and blatantly feed the enemy team. im not talking about people who do poorly in lane and go 0/6/0 i am talking about the people that literally go out of their way to feed the enemy team because they have gotten upset at something that has happened. for example i just had a game where our yasuo ran down each lane and fed no less than 10 kills to the enemy team because i banned Ekko. the new champion. we were purple team so i did not want to let them have him because new champs have a tendency to be a little OP. this sort of behavior is poor and there should at least be some way we can take something positive away from an experience like this.

replies.body: I don't mean loss prevention for the feeder. i mean loss prevention for each other member of the team. (or at least no loss of LP, demotions, that sort of thing) say for example there was a way to detect someone was feeding intentionally say dying 4 or 5 times in a row within a set amount of time and getting no assists or kills for it. i know i don't have the answer, only suggestions. but i just hate the fact that i am cost divisions in ranked (both demotions and promos) because someone cracked the shits they didn't get what they wanted so fed causing all of us to lose.

Kind of the same point as with leavers - at which points does it become convenient to start feeding rather than play the game as intended?
If the result is just bans and penalties - never.
If the result is penalties AND a bonus for the team, well, maybe sometimes it's worth it to just "take one for the team".

You just suggested the best way to have more feeders in the game.

Five years people have been asking for this, IT WONT HAPPEN.

It's a completely abusable concept that wont ever work as intended.
sometimes feeders can b an advantage tho. enemy aims them in teamfights
